title: Does this tabla look good to buy?
selftext:
Hi. I'm trying to buy a tabla. I'm a musician and always loved the instrument. I don't know much about it, so I was hoping somebody can tell me if this looks like a good one to buy. I live in a place where this instrument is not easy to buy, and I'm buying from someplace else in my country, so any advice and what things to look for is appreciated.

Others I looked to buy are more expensive, almost double, and don't have ornaments on the bayan.  I don't know if that's something to look for.

Thanks!

&#x200B;

https://preview.redd.it/l5zwiubu5kqa1.png?width=387&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=440e8f4ffe3f15c85b1b5be2f62cbebc57d4ab5b

https://preview.redd.it/jhs3s9hv5kqa1.png?width=580&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=30712095cdbddae69d2aa59c675b0c3808618a63
comments: I think you should look if they are physically intact, and verify that they play well. ðŸ¤”

That'd be impossible. All the tablas that I can find to buy in my country are from other province. I don't think I'll ever see a tabla in my city to be honest. Also, despite being a musician for many years and knowing many instruments, I wouldn't know what to look for on a tabla and wouldn't be able to judge the sound too much.

Any indications on what to look for?
